chapter.pericope: Living in the Light of the Limits of Human Knowledge

ul.li1: 1Send out your bread on the water,
ul.li2: for in many days you will find it.
ul.li1: 2Divide your share in seven or in eight,
ul.li2: for you do not know what disaster will happen on the earth.
they empty rain on the earth.
ul.li1: Whether a tree falls to the south or whether it falls to the north,
ul.li2: the place where the tree falls—there it will be.
ul.li1: 4Whoever watches the wind will not sow;
ul.li2: whoever watches the clouds will not reap.
ul.li1: 5Just as you do not know how the path of the windOr “the breath” goes,
ul.li2: nor how the bones of a fetus form in a mother’s womb,
ul.li1: so you do not know the work of God who makes everything.
ul.li2: and do not let your hands rest in the evening,
ul.li1: for you do not know what will prosper—
ul.li2: whether this or that, or whether both of them alike will succeed.

chapter.pericope: Enjoy Life to the Fullest within the Auspices of the Fear of God

ul.li2: and it is pleasant for the eyes to see the sun.
ul.li1: 8For if a man lives many years,
ul.li2: let him rejoice in all of them!
ul.li1: Let him remember that the days of the darkness will be many—
ul.li2: all that is coming is vanity!
ul.li1: 9Rejoice, O young man, in your youth,
ul.li2: and let your heart cheer you in the days of your youth!
ul.li1: Follow the ways of your heart and the sight of your eyes—
ul.li2: but know that God will bring you into judgment for all these things.
and put away pain from your body,
ul.li1: for youth and vigor are vanity.
